"Each participant will be given maximum of 2 hours to complete their sketch.
All participants must bring their college identity cards.
Participants without identity cards will not be allowed to participate.
Any pencil sketch is allowed in the event.
Materials provided: Drawing sheets, Pencils, Erasers and Sharpeners.
The decision of the judge shall be FINAL and BINDING."
Settings
mun rules

"Rounds : 1 Round
Eligibility : Participation in the form of a band of 3-10 members only.
• The use of laptops or mixers or any other digital modifiers is prohibited.
• Each band will be allotted a total of 30 minutes (Amps on to Amps off. Inclusive of sound check).
• A drum kit, 5-6 microphones and sufficient input lines will be provided on stage. Other instruments are to be brought by participants.
• Original compositions are welcome.
• Medleys and mashups are allowed, provided the performance comes under the given time limit.
• Obscenity and vulgarity of any manner is not allowed in neither the lyrics nor in gestures.
• Judges’ decision will be final and binding.
• No pre-recorded music is allowed."

"Rounds : 2 rounds (Qualifying Round and Final Round)
Eligibility : Solo Performance on Karaoke Track
First round is a knock out round. In this round, the contestant is free to sing a song of his/her choice.
Based on the performance in this round, participants will be selected for the final round.
Final round includes two performances by each finalist - one of the finalist’s choice, one of the judges’ choice. (To be selected from a list of 3 songs provided by the participant).
 Every contestant must bring his/her own karaoke tracks.
He/she must bring at least 5 tracks (2 for the participant’s choice rounds and three for the judges’ choice round).
• All the contestants should bring the tracks in a CD/Pen drive.
• Language of performance is restricted to Hindi and English only.
 No pre-recorded music is allowed.
 Judges’ decision will be final and binding."

"Rounds : 2 rounds (Qualifying Round and Final Round)
Eligibility : Duet Performance on Karaoke Track
 First round is a knock out round. In this round, the contestants are free to sing a song of their choice.
 Based on the performance in this round, groups will be selected for the final round.
 Final round includes two performances by each selected group-one of group’s choice and one of judges’ choice (to be selected from a list of 3 songs provided by the group)
Every group must bring their own karaoke tracks.
 Each participating group must bring at least 5 tracks (2 for the Contestant’s choice rounds and three for the judges’ choice round).
All the participants should bring the tracks in a CD/Pen drive.
 Language of performance is restricted to Hindi and English only."

"Rounds : 1 Round
Eligibility : Solo performance on any instrument
Participants are not allowed to use laptops or mixers or any other digital modifiers.
Drum kit will be provided by the organizing team on stage for drummers.
The on-stage time limit is 10 minutes. (amps on to amps off).
Participant may lend his/her voice if they wish to. The judging, however will only be based on the instrumental performance.
Original compositions are welcome.
No pre-recorded music is allowed."

"Rounds : 1 Round
Eligibility : Participation in the form of a group of 2-7 members only.
 Participants are not allowed to use laptops or mixers or any other digital modifiers.
Only acoustic and semi - acoustic instruments are allowed. Synthesizer and bass guitar are allowed.
Each group will be allotted 15 minutes for performance (inclusive of sound check).
A drum kit, 5-6 microphones and sufficient input lines will be provided on stage. Other instruments are to be brought by participants.
Judging will be based on overall group performance.
 Original compositions are welcome.
No pre-recorded music is allowed.
Judges’ decision will be final and binding."

"It will be a team competition with one model and 1 painter. Only the painter needs to register for the event.
It’ll be an open theme competition.
All participants must carry the identity card of their respective colleges.
Participants without identity cards will not be allowed to participate.
Winners in Fine arts genre will receive cash prize of 5k and goodies worth 30k.
Each team will be given maximum 3 hours to complete their painting.
Special Effects may be used including:- False eyelashes, glitter.
Masks, elastic or tape are not allowed.
Basic equipments like water colour and brushes will be given, but the participants themselves need to bring any other equipment like sponges and acrylic colours if they wish.
Judges decision will be FINAL and BINDING on all participants."

"There will be a single round.
The duo couple will be given 2-6 minutes to perform.
The audio track must be submitted in a pen-drive or hard disk in .mp3 format, at the time of confirmation of registration at the event venue.
All participants must bring their college identity cards.
Song must be brought by the participating team in a CD, DVD or Pen drive-if they don’t, disqualified.
The songs must not contain any illicit or offensive language.
Any obscene action in the dance is prohibited and will lead to Disqualification.
All props, costumes and make-up will have to be brought by the teams.
No props will be provided by the organizers. In case of special prop requirement such as chairs, the teams will have to inform the organizers in advance.
Use of flame or fluid on stage, lighting of candles, matches or cigarettes is strictly NOT allowed and will lead in Disqualification of the team."

"There will be a single round.
The individual will be given 3-6 minutes to perform.
The individual must bring the audio track in a pen-drive or hard disk in .mp3 format and submit it at the time of confirmation of registration at the event venue.
The songs must not contain any illicit or offensive language.
Any obscene action in the dance is prohibited and will lead to Disqualification.
All participants must bring their college identity cards. Participants without identity cards will not be allowed to participate.
Use of flame or fluid on stage, lighting of candles, matches or cigarettes is strictly NOT allowed and will lead in Disqualification.
Participants have to arrange for their own props, costumes and make-up. No props will be provided by the organizers. However, in case of special prop requirement such as chairs the participants will have to inform the organizers in advance.
In case of malfunctioning of any equipment provided, the participant will be allowed to repeat the performance or start from the point of disruption as he/she chooses, with the consent of the judges."

"2 Rounds – Qualifying and Final
 Stage setting time: 1.5 minutes (maximum).
Time limit: 5-10 minutes. Exceeding this will lead to penalization in marks.
Team limit : 22 + 2 CAs(for light and sound)
All dance forms are allowed.
Use of water, fire and glass is prohibited.
Audio track to be brought in .mp3 format, in a pen drive or a hard disk and should be submitted by group on the registration desk.
The songs must not contain any illicit or offensive language.
 Any obscene action in the dance is prohibited and will lead to Disqualification.
Any specific requirements regarding lights and smoke must be discussed with coordinator well in advance.
Use of Voice Over(s) is allowed."

"Each contestant will be given a time limit of 8 minutes.
The contestants are allowed to do anything like Stand-up comedy, Mimicry, mime, Impromptu or any other skill they wish to perform.
This is strictly a Solo act competition.
The language of act is strictly prohibited to English/Hindi.
The contestants’ performances are scrutinized and are judged based upon the creativity, stage presence and interest shown in entertaining the crowd.
Instrumental music is allowed but the participants will have to bring their own instruments.
Microphones, lights and laptop to play sounds will be provided.
Naked flames or live animals are not allowed on stage.
Participants will have to bring their own music in CD/PD.
The judges might ask the contestants to perform something on the spot to test their skills.
The top three performances judged the jury gets to be the winners of the competition."

"Group of maximum 22 members have to perform a Street Play of any genre.
The maximum time permitted for each play is 30 minutes.
Each group will be judged mainly on performance, script and various other aspects.
Music accompanists are included in the team size stated above.
Teams are expected to perform at the open air venue with audience on all sides.
Only live music is allowed. Teams will have to bring their own instruments.
Any vulgarity/obscenity will be strictly penalized and may lead to disqualification.
Any kind of fluids, live animals, flame, heavy and sharp objects or any other harmful material is STRICTLY not allowed.
Teams will be heavily penalised if they exceed the time limit.
Logistics should be self-arranged.
Each group will be judged mainly on performance, script and various other aspects."

"
Group have to perform a Stage Play of any genre.
Team Limit: 15 members + 3 CAs (for light and sound).
The minimum time for stage play is 15 minutes and maximum time permitted for each play is 45 minutes.
Language of the play can be Hindi/English. Mime is allowed.
Pre-registration is necessary before the date of the event.
Recorded vocals are not allowed, only music is allowed.
The teams will have to bring their own music in CDs/PDs.
No naked flames or live animals are allowed on stage.
Sound and Lights will be arranged by the Organisation.
No other logistics will be provided from the Organisation. The costumes and logistics must be self-arranged.
Use of foul language or any obscenity will lead to immediate disqualification.
In case of malfunctioning of any equipment provided, group will be allowed to repeat their performance from the last point of disruption. The decision will be as per judges’ direction for how to give grace time."

The team size can be maximum 20 people including actors.
The maximum time limit for the short film will be 15 minutes.
The movie should either be in Hindi or English or both. No other languages are permitted.
The video may be taken with any device.
The theme of the competition is 'Youngistaan : A Montage Of Dreams'.
The short films have to be submitted either Online/Offline by 12th of January.
For Online submission share the Google Drive link to publicrelations@almafiesta.com
Obscenity of any kind is not allowed and shall lead to disqualification.
The decision of the judges and the organizing team will be final.
Alma Fiesta reserves the right to use the video entries on social media (suitable credits will be given to the people responsible for the creation of the content).
The winning entries will be published on our Facebook page."

Team Size: 1 member.
Submission deadline: 11:59 pm each day during the 3 days of fest. The online submission link will be shared before the fest.
Photographs must be taken inside the campus and during the events only.
The more diversity in photos brings you more points.
Participant can submit at max 5 photos each day.
Photographs must contain EXIF data.
Participants must submit both raw images (CR2/NEF/SR2, etc) and edited images (jpeg/jpg).
Do not include your credentials (Name, Watermark, Date, etc) in the frame of the photograph.
Photographs should not contain any objectionable content. If found, entry will be disqualified by judge’s consent.
Only global editing is allowed.
Alma Fiesta reserves the right to use the entries (suitable credits will be given to the people responsible for the creation of the content).

The maximum team size is 10 members.
The teams will have to come to the campus and shoot for three days.
The maximum duration for the documentary is 10 minutes.
The participants will have to submit their videos offline.
The participants must be present at the specified venue during the judging of their submission.
Judging criteria includes fest coverage, content, editing and overall impact of the video.
Alma Fiesta reserves the right to use the video entries on social media.
The top documentaries will be featured in Alma Fiesta after movie, so you may be asked to submit the unedited shots.

"चरण 1 : समूह-चर्चा –
समूह चर्चा में प्रतिभागियों को 4-4 के समूह में बाँट दिया जायेगा।
चर्चा के लिए एक विषय दिया जायेगा जो कि किसी भी प्रकार का हो सकता है।
स्व-विचार हेतु 2 मिनट तथा समूह चर्चा हेतु 10 मिनट दिए जायेंगे।
प्रतियोगिता के प्रथम चरण के प्रदर्शन के आधार पर 10 प्रतिभागी अंतिम चरण के लिए चुने जायेंगे।
चरण 2 : वाद-विवाद –
यह एक वाद-विवाद प्रतियोगिता होगी जिसके नियम पहले चरण की समाप्ति के बाद बताये जायेंगे।
्व-विचार हेतु 2 मिनट तथा समूह चर्चा हेतु 10 मिनट दिए जायेंगे।
सामान्य निर्देश :-
प्रतियोगिता में चर्चा का समय सीमा से अधिक होने पर उस चर्चा में उपस्थित सभी प्रतिभागियों का नकारात्मक अंकन किया जाएगा ।
िर्णायक मण्डली का निर्णय अंतिम होगा । "

"चरण 1 :
प्रतिभागी को सर्वप्रथम दिए गये विषयों में से किसी एक का चुनाव करना होगा
िषय पर सोचने हेतु प्रतिभागी को 30 सेकंड का समय दिया जाएगा
प्रतिभागी को 2 मिनट में विचार व्यक्त करने होंगे अपने निष्कर्ष को 30 सेकंड में व्यक्त करना होगा
चरण 2 :
यह भी एक आशुभाषण प्रतियोगिता होगी, जिसके नियम और दिशानिर्देश प्रथम चरण की समाप्ति के समय स्पष्ट किये जायेंगे ।
सामान्य निर्देश :-
रतियोगिता में तय सीमा के बाद भी बोलते रहने पर नकारात्मक अंकन किया जाएगा ।
िर्णायक मण्डली का निर्णय अंतिम होगा । "

It is an individual competition.
Only original work of the participant is entertained. Plagiarism of any kind leads to a direct disqualification.
The poem may be in either Hindi or English.
Poems need to be submitted by 11:59 p.m., 11th January at am34@iitbbs.ac.in
A participant can recite a maximum of 1 poem only.
All entries should be original compositions in English or Hindi.
Time limit for each performance - 5 min
Obscenity of any kind is not allowed.
Participants are requested to carry their own props, if any to be used by them during performance.
Participants may carry a piece of paper or phone which they may refer to while reciting but reciting without help shall be an advantage.
The Judges’ decision shall be final in all matters pertaining to participation and organization of the competition.Judging Criteria
• Stage presence
• Voice and articulation
• Performance 
• Content
• Body language
Note: The judging criteria may vary slightly based on the preference of the judges, however in this event, the new criteria shall be duly announced prior to the event."
